item.title: Juliet add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Juliet add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Salman Rushdie
item.description: "Go for broke. Always try and do too much. Dispense with safety nets. Take a deep breath before you begin talking. Aim for the stars. Keep grinning. Be bloody-minded. Argue with the world. And never forget that writing is as close as we get to keeping a hold on the thousand and one things--childhood, certainties, cities, doubts, dreams, instants, phrases, parents, loves--that go on slipping , like sand, through our fingers." -- Salman Rushdie

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Vincent van Gogh
item.description: "Only when I fall do I get up again." -- Vincent van Gogh

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "In the sky, there is no distinction of east and west; people create distinctions out of their own minds and then believe them to be true." -- Buddha

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "History is that certainty produced at the point where the imperfections of memory meet the inadequacies of documentation." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Julian Barnes
item.description: "How often do we tell our own life story? How often do we adjust, embellish, make sly cuts? And the longer life goes on, the fewer are those around to challenge our account, to remind us that our life is not our life, merely the story we have told about our life. Told to others, but&mdash;mainly&mdash;to ourselves." -- Julian Barnes

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Juliet add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero
